basic.floral_language:
Graptoveria 'Silver star' 
Floriography: enchanting, brave, novel
Silver star is a unique hybrid succulent. Leaf shape like pumpkin seeds, closely arranged in rosette, has leaf tips with extended 1 cm long red silk-like filaments, very charming.
Silver Star likes sunny places with half shade tolerance, in summer takes a short sleep, shade properly under scattered light. Flowers sometimes but usually dies after flowering, should cut flower buds off.
basic.color: Leaf color green , leaf edges red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, a short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
